questions.description: Your answers will help us define your group's style and will — in the end — connect you with the perfect traveling companions. Aready have people mind? That's cool. You can invite 'em later.

questions.header: How many folks are you ready to lead?
questions.description: Think about your space. Perhaps you can base this on how many people fit comfortably in your living room, or the number of chairs that fit around your dining room table.
questions.label: I have room for:

questions.header: Of those ({{responses.total_capacity}} spots) how many are open to anyone?
questions.description: For example: If you can lead {{responses.total_capacity}}, but you already know that your brother will be in your group — then your answer here would be {{responses.total_capacity - 1}}.
questions.label: My group is open to:
questions.footer:
Did you mean to select ZERO?
By selecting zero, you are creating a private group. And you could be missing out on meeting someone awesome.

questions.description: Pick the one that most represents how you feel.

questions.header: What kind of group are you interested in hosting?
questions.description: We’re not trying to create a grade school lunchroom dynamic... but some groups choose to roll with just guys, others with strictly gals.

answers: Men only group (Don't pick this if you're a woman please)

questions.header: Are kids welcome or is this adults only?
questions.description: Being kid friendly does not mean that you have to run a day care. Only that you are open to people bringing thier kids along with them.
answers: Kid friendly (We will supply a tips sheet for this at the end.)

questions.header: When do you want to meet?
questions.description: Remember that BRAVE groups meet once a week for 5 weeks. They begin the week of April 3rd and will end the week of May 1st. They usually take less than 90 minutes from start to finish.
We want to make sure people are choosing groups they can get to. This is the address we have on file. Please edit if we got it wrong.

answers: Nope. First time and I am so excited!

questions.description: You're almost done. Let's just add a little of your own personality. Some flavor if you will.

questions.header: You'll end up with something like this...
questions.help: FYI: Don't worry about the profile pic. It'll be your Crossroads.net profile picture. So what ever you load there, will appear here. Yay technology!

questions.description: Write a few highlights that tell people what you're all about.
questions.label: Your message
questions.help: Example: Hi, I'm Kevin, a 30 something father, husband and Bengals apologist. This isn't my first rodeo, but it's my first time hosting a group. We’ll be meeting at my humble home in Hyde Park.

questions.header: Now for the most important step!
questions.description: You are about to see your completed profile. And we need you to check and double check your info. Seriously. Once you give this thing the greenlight, there are no takebacks.
No pressure, this is only going to be viewable to thousands of people.
